column4: can someone recomend a IRC klient that i can run from Putty? :P
you mean from termial?
yes :)
irssi
screen and irssi works great together..
whats screen? :P

magic for the console..:). once you putty into a linux machine then sudo apt-get install screen .. after install type screen and you'll get a disclaimer screen .. hit enter.. and you back to a console prompt
okey? but what is it? :P

from that point you don't have to open different ssh or putty sessions to do different things on that box.. and you can "disconnect" from that screen session and putty connection and come back later to resume right where you left off.
are you putty'd into a machine now?
yes :)
I'll walk you through some of the tricks.. sudo apt-get install screen irssi
WHAA X) i started irssi how do i get out of it? :P
wait.. did you also start screen?
no :P i started irssi before you told me to get screen :P
/quit will exit irssi and dump any connections
ooh, i tried /exit hehe :P
once you exit type screen
yes*
ok.. now type irssi
yeah :)
you now have irssi loaded in "window" number 0.. push ctrl+a (small a)
now push c
did it take you back to a console prompt?
yes :)
how do i connect freenode (this irc server? :P)
you are now in window number 1.. lets split the screen  push ctrl+a shift+s (to give you a capital S)
dont remember how i did
huh ?:P
did it split?
did not understand that sorry :P
ctrl+a shift+s
yes now, set title window to bash or somthing :P
ok.. is irssi in the top or bottom?
top :P
ok.. and the cursor is blinkin in the "entry" line for irssi?
yes*
or its green :P
now ctrl+a TAB to shift to the lower half that is empty.. now ctrl+a c
but i can enter text there
aha nice! :(
how do i make itlook like this: [_] [_]    if you understand :P
it gets better.. you're catching on that ctrl+a is always teh preface for any other command
not sure I understand
hmm... now they are horisontal
i want it ehm, whats the others name? XD
not sure I'm following..
side by side? or one on top of the other?
i want the fields to be Vertikal
yeah side by side
that would be a verticle split.. sorry it doesn't do that from what I've been reading..
oooh :(
now if you want to experiment a little .. try ctrl+a c in either window or split half
heh, okej ^^
now sudo apt-get install surfraw elinks
whats that? ^^
elinks is a terminal browser for the internet and surfraw is something that allows searching the net FAST before loading the browser
okey? ^^ but ill use firefox in Windows if i need anything, i dont have the fastest internet connection :P
terminal searching is quick because there's no graphics involved.. did you load it?
or install it??
sorry no :P but i dont think ill need it hehe :P
ok.. one thing you need to learn is how to detach and reattach to screen..
heh, okej ? :P
to detach ctrl+a d ... try it.. everything will disappear
okej :P did i kill irssi?
or is it still running?
nope that's part of the magick..
oooh ;)
you could even close the putty session and it would continue to run
heh okej :P but how do i get it back? :P
to reattach you need to know what the screen number is.. so now type screen -ls
the line that is shown has a 4 digit number at the beginning of it.  to reattach type screen -r <number>
okej :)
how do i remove the others?
i have 5 here XD ill bet i did something :P
yep.. you typed screen 5 times just after you loaded it.. so you have to attach to one at a time and see if there's nothing there then /exit
hmmm :P
/exit does not work :S
hang on
bash: /exit: No such file or directory :S
/quit  maybe
I knew it was something like that :/
hehe nps :P
if i dont want screen anymore? how do i remove it=? i bet it takes some process :P...

you mean close it entirely?  you can "exit" all the screens and they won't be running.. on reboot of the remote machine will also close screeen and it won't restart on reboot without you typing screen
yeah close entirely :P whitout reboot
is there a "short" commant to exit all at the same time? or do i have to "go into" everone and type exit? :/
just exit as the other nick suggested.. to close the split ctrl+a shift+x
each one is running independantly.. so yes you have to go into each one as far as I know..
okey :/
well, i have to go to bed now :P im realy tired as you maybe can recognize XD
tnx for the help im realy glad that you helped me :)
now i feel like a pro whit linux ;) just kidding ;)
I've been learning this for 3 yrs. just in the last couple weeks I've tried to live at terminal as much as possible.. just for fun and experience.
yeah :) and i realy have to learn Linux to get a well paid work ^^ im just at school now but i realy would like to manage linux :P
me too but I'm almost 50.. little age descrimination when you're competing with 25 yr olds. :(
hehe, nhaa i hope im done when im 19 ^^ im 18 now XD
